result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew Roger Davis

defendant.name: Davis, Matthew Roger
defendant.address: 317 S. Fillmore Street, Apt 3, Prairie Du Chien, WI 53821

records.addlTxt: After the 10/17/22 hearing, Attorney Richards advised that he had a time conflict with the Jan. 26, 2023 jury status date and requested the date be moved to Jan. 25, 2023.  JA approved the request and moved all four cases to Jan. 25, 2023 at 9:00 AM by Zoom.
Jury status hearing on January 25, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Jury status hearing on January 26, 2023 at 10:00 am.

10:32 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Matthew Roger Davis appeared by phone.  Attorney Steven G. Richards in court for Matthew Roger Davis.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Richards is heard. Waives reading of the information. Defendant entered pleas of Not Guilty, clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count in each case. 

22CF48 Defendant plead not guilty  
22CF114 Defendant plead not guilty 
22CF128  Defendant plead not guilty 
22CF146  Defendant plead not guilty
Jury status hearing scheduled for January 26, 2023 at 10:00 am.

3:34 PM 22CF48, 22CF114, 22CF128 & 22CF146 called together
Defendant Matthew Roger Davis in court.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Matthew Roger Davis.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared in court or State of Wisconsin. 

Atty. Richards states def. will be waiving the preliminary hearing today in cases 22CF114, 22CF128, & 22CF146

Court reviews waiver of preliminary hearing and questionnaire form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives right to preliminary hearing, binds def. over for further proceedings

Atty. Richards requests another date for Arraignment
Arraignment scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.. Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing on October 12, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

11:39 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Matthew Roger Davis in court.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Matthew Roger Davis.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

State requests both prelims be adjourned to Oct 12th so all cases can track together.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

9:52 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Matthew Roger Davis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court will immediately release defendant. Court cancels warrant.
Preliminary hearing on October 5, 2022 at 11:30 am.

10:38 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Matthew Roger Davis in court.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Matthew Roger Davis.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Richards is heard on the status. Will be waiving time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 11:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
1:44 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Matthew Roger Davis in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

22CF114 - Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.   

22CF128 - Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  

Right to counsel is explained.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.

3:29 PM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Matthew R Davis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause - will address bond

Atty. Steiner is heard on issue of bond - requests $250.00 cash - Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw.  Def. has posted $150.00 in 22CF48 - 
 Def. has an initial appearance set in 22CF114  on 9-6-22

Defendant is heard on issue of bond -

Court orders $150.00 cash bond - conditions Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. 

Right to counsel explained to defendant.
Hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
